item.title: Revisiting my first PhD paper - A hard-fought battle with peer-review
item.description:
Unfortunately it was not a smooth journey. Here is the overall timeline: 

  • Bayesian Analysis: Submitted 08/30/2012, rejected 09/16/2012. Not much to say here, except that I am grateful for the rapid decision that helped me move on to the next journal :)

  • Computational Statistics and Data Analysis: Submitted 09/20/2012, rejected 04/30/2013. This substantive delay was mentally agonizing.

  • Journal of Machine Learning Research: Submitted 04/30/2013, rejected 10/28/10 with some constructive reviews that led to a substantive improvement of the manuscript.

  • Statistics and Its Interface: Submitted 08/16/2013, first review 12/09/2013, resubmitted 05/20/2014 (got delayed by a few other dissertation projects), second revision requested 06/27/2014, revised version submitted 06/30/2014, accepted 8/15/2014. 

What is your worst peer-review experience?
